title: Implement heap points-to analysis for GRIN
body:
Implement the heap points-to (HPT) analysis that most GRIN optimisations depend on.

**Deliverables:**
- Abstract interpretation over GRIN programs that computes, for each variable and heap location, the set of possible node types (tags + field types)
- Fixed-point iteration until the analysis converges
- Result type: `HptResult` mapping each variable/heap-loc to a set of possible `(Tag, [AbstractType])`
- `AbstractType`: `Node(TagSet)`, `SimpleType(BaseTy)`, `Pointer(LocSet)`
- Unit tests with hand-written GRIN programs and expected analysis results

**Design notes:**
- HPT is GRIN's foundational analysis — dead code elimination, unboxing, case simplification all depend on it
- Reference: Boquist thesis Chapter 5; Hruska et al. 2020 Section 4
- Start with a simple, correct implementation; performance optimisation later
- Consider using Soufflé datalog in future (mentioned in GRIN overview), but implement directly in Zig first
